intro: Disterigma utleyorum, commonly known as the Utley's disterigma, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
